summary:
A Microbiologist and Biotechnologist, sales associate dealing with IVD medical equipment.  A scientist/analyst with good understanding of qualitative, quantitative methods and GCP/GLP/GMP. 

With interest around advocacy and development programmes involving CSOs, I am an enthusiastic, self-motivated and reliable with experience of mobilising teams and executing evidence - based suggestions to be enacted by the decision makers(developed and lead a team of youth dubbed "Youth for change-Kenya"as a co-chair presentating to IEBC proposals on reduction of aspirant fees paid by Youth, Women and PWDs, which was adopted and is in practice-as a matter of fact, this saw a great rise in number of candidates under these categories in the 2022 elections).
 I possess great enthusiasm towards deep understanding of global development issues surrounding governance, health, peace and stability,food security, public health, gender, youth and PWDs. 

 A great team player with great organizational
skills, tech savvy, and adaptable to all challenging situations. I can work well both in a team environment as well as using my initiative. I possess good attributes towards the secrecy of my places of work and strict adherence to the laid-out instructions. A great timekeeper and a charming human as well.

My key strengths:
. Relationship builder and strong communicator 
. Programme management. 
. Collaborative marketing and team building. 
. Sales and marketing 
. Research on policy and climate actions. 
. Organising meetings and planning agenda with key  stakeholders e.g. Abbott Point Of Care Symposium held in Nairobi, 2023.
. Establishing and sustaining rapport leading to coordination with teams, both cross-functional and multi-cultural.
. Training and presentation. 
. Financial and Narrative report writing and analysis.
. Laboratory reports and analysis of samples.
. Knowledge of HACCPS and ISO certification requirements
. Microbial analysis of samples.
. Stakeholders engagement and follow-up on discussed resolutions and agreed points.
. Projection of sales using available analysed sales reports

currentPositions.description: Product specialist for Wondfo Finecare fluorescence immunoassay analyzer
currentPositions.title: Product Specialist

skills.name: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)

headline: In Vitro Diagnostics|sales associate|communication and strategy|Medical/Vaccine research & developmemt|climate advocacy|Epidemiology|Environmental sustainability|Quality assurance|Ingredients sales|Public health

message.text:
Rewarding employee's performance is one of the healthy ways of maintaining the morale and appreciation for your team. Glad to have been considered the best product specialist  for the first quarter of the year 2024. My product,the WONDFO KENYA finecare, an outstanding fluorescence immunoassay analyzer with great precision and reliability makes it easy for the end-user. More literature on the test parameters are available on the Wondfo  website and WONDFO KENYA page.

#FINECARE
#FS205
#FS114
#FS113
#Mediglobe
#wondfo

I had the opportunity to also meet the former prime minister Rt. Hon. Raila Odinga, EGH at the Jaramogi Oginga Odinga foundation. 

The prime minister is concerned about the young people as they form the largest part of our population. Women and children as part of the vulnerable groups, especially at the moment when the rains have wrecked havoc in our country.

 He reiterated the big role opposition plays in the country and how the people form an integral part of it. The opposition side is keen on supporting the government and other stakeholders to form policies that would impact and improve the livelihoods of the vulnerable groups,the medics and all Kenyans at large.

Earlier today at statehouse-Kenya, we had a robust discussion with the President of the Republic of Kenya. The president emphasises on the need to focus on climate change and why the country has had to observe tree planting holidays. 

On top of our discussion was the issue of misuse of some of the antimicrobials leading to great resistance among the population. 

Antimicrobial Resistance #AMR is a big problem facing #publichealth & humanity currently.In the year 2019, approximately  one hundred thousand deaths were reported in S. Saharan Africa , more than #HIV and malaria. With estimates of 50M deaths by 2050, annually 

#Bacteriophages found abundantly in nature are the natural enemies of bacteria & are considered game-changers in the fight against #AMR. (Institute of Primate Research) 

President Ruto is as well passionate about the lives of students after internship. A better framework should be put in place with more opportunities created to absorb interns into meaningful employment at the end of internship period.

#AMR
#vaccines
#publicpolicy
#CSOs
#communitydevelopment
Glad to announce my previous completion of GCP training. Looking forward to applying my vast understanding of research processes and ethics.
